sen.j: 青山 胤通（あおやま たねみち、安政6年5月15日 (旧暦)（1859年6月15日） - 大正6年（1917年）12月23日）は医学者、医学博士。
sen.e: Tanemichi AOYAMA was a medical scientist and doctor of medicine, and was born in June 15, 1859 and died on December 23, 1917.
Tanemichi AOYAMA (June 15, 1859 - December 23, 1917) was a medical scientist and doctor of medicine.
sen.cmt: 生年没年は括弧内に入れました。
sen.e: Tanemichi AOYAMA (June 15, 1859 - December 23, 1917) was a medical scientist and doctor of medicine.
He specialized in internal medicine.
He specialized in internal medicine.
He specialized in internal medicine.

sen.j: 1906年帝国学士院会員、1916年勲一等瑞宝章、1917年12月14日男爵受爵。
sen.e: He was enlisted in the Imperial Academy in 1906, granted the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure in 1916, and conferred baron on December 14, 1917.
He was enlisted in the Imperial Academy in 1906, granted the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure in 1916, and conferred baron on December 14, 1917.
He was enlisted in the Imperial Academy in 1906, granted the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure in 1916, and conferred baron on December 14, 1917.

sen.j: 江戸に苗木藩藩士・青山景通の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Edo as the third son of Kagemichi AOYAMA, who was a feudal retainer of the Naeki domain.
He was born in Edo as the third son of Kagemichi AOYAMA, who was a feudal retainer of the Naeki domain.
He was born in Edo as the third son of Kagemichi AOYAMA, who was a feudal retainer of the Naeki domain.

sen.j: 1882年 東京大学医学部卒業後、同大病理学教室助手就任。
sen.e: After graduating from the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Medicine, in 1882, he became an assistant for a pathology class at the university.
After graduating from the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Medicine in 1882, he became an assistant for a pathology class at the same university.
sen.cmt: in 1882の前のコンマを削除し、同大学の意味で、sameを挿入しました。
sen.e: After graduating from the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Medicine in 1882, he became an assistant for a pathology class at the same university.

sen.j: ベルリン大学留学等を経て、東京大学医科大学校内科学第一講座（青山内科として君臨）教授、東京帝国大医科大学校長、伝染病研究所（現東京大学医科学研究所）所長等を歴任。
sen.e: He studied abroad at Humboldt University of Berlin, and worked as a professor of the first course for internal medicine in Medical College at Tokyo University, which was known as 'Aoyama Internal Medicine'; he also held posts as president of Medical College at Tokyo Imperial University and head of the Institute of Infectious Disease, now the Institute of Medical Science, the University of Tokyo.

After he studied abroad at Humboldt University of Berlin, and worked as a professor of the first course for internal medicine in Medical College at Tokyo University, which was known as 'Aoyama Internal Medicine'; he also held posts as president of Medical College at Tokyo Imperial University and head of the Institute of Infectious Disease (present the Institute of Medical Science of the University of Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 文頭にAfterを挿入し、文末の括弧内の説明は、同じく括弧に挿入しました。
sen.e: After he studied abroad at Humboldt University of Berlin, and worked as a professor of the first course for internal medicine in Medical College at Tokyo University, which was known as 'Aoyama Internal Medicine'; he also held posts as president of Medical College at Tokyo Imperial University and head of the Institute of Infectious Disease (present the Institute of Medical Science of the University of Tokyo).

sen.j: 明治天皇の侍医、宮内庁御用掛を勤める。
sen.e: He was a court physician for the Emperor Meiji and served as a goyo-gakari for the Imperial Household Agency.
He was a court physician for the Emperor Meiji and served as a goyo-gakari (functions to do the business) for the Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: goyo-gakariの意味を括弧で補足しました。
sen.e: He was a court physician for the Emperor Meiji and served as a goyo-gakari (functions to do the business) for the Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 1901年癌研究会を設立し、会頭を務める。
sen.e: He founded the Foundation for Cancer Research and became its president.
He founded the Foundation for Cancer Research in 1901 and became its president.
sen.cmt: 年号が抜けているので追加しました。
sen.e: He founded the Foundation for Cancer Research in 1901 and became its president.

sen.j: 墓所は台東区谷中 (台東区)の谷中霊園。
sen.e: His graveyard is in Yanaka Cemetery of Yanaka, Taito Ward.
His graveyard is in Yanaka Cemetery of Yanaka, Taito Ward.
His graveyard is in Yanaka Cemetery of Yanaka, Taito Ward.

sen.j: 東京大学薬学部東側に新海竹太郎作の銅像がある。
sen.e: His bronze statue, made by Taketaro SHINKAI, is placed east of Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences at Tokyo University.
His bronze statue, made by Taketaro SHINKAI, is placed at the east side of Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences at Tokyo University.
sen.cmt: 東側をat the east sideとしました。
sen.e: His bronze statue, made by Taketaro SHINKAI, is placed at the east side of Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences at Tokyo University.

sen.j: 青山徹蔵（元東京帝国大医学部第一外科学教室教授）は養子。
sen.e: Tetsuzo AOYAMA, a former professor for the first surgical class of Faculty of Medicine at Tokyo Imperial University, was his adopted son.
Tetsuzo AOYAMA (a former professor for the first surgical class of Faculty of Medicine at Tokyo Imperial University) was his adopted son.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の説明は括弧に入れました。
sen.e: Tetsuzo AOYAMA (a former professor for the first surgical class of Faculty of Medicine at Tokyo Imperial University) was his adopted son.

sen.j: 北里柴三郎と野口英世の排斥者、批判者として知られる。
sen.e: He is known for having denounced and criticized Shibasaburo KITAZATO and Hideyo NOGUCHI.
He is known for having denounced and criticized Shibasaburo KITAZATO and Hideyo NOGUCHI.
He is known for having denounced and criticized Shibasaburo KITAZATO and Hideyo NOGUCHI.

sen.j: 鈴木梅太郎の業績を批判したとも言われるが、これは別人であるとの説も根強い。
sen.e: He is also said to have criticized the achievements of Umetaro SUZUKI, but this may be attributed to someone else, as suggested by a major theory.
He is also said to have criticized the achievements of Umetaro SUZUKI, but this may be attributed to someone else, as suggested by a major theory.
He is also said to have criticized the achievements of Umetaro SUZUKI, but this may be attributed to someone else, as suggested by a major theory.

sen.j: 森鴎外とも親交があり、彼の親友である原田直次郎の治療も行っている。
sen.e: He also had a close relationship with Ogai MORI, and treated one of Ogai's best friends named Naojiro HARADA
He also had a close relationship with Ogai MORI, and treated one of Ogai's best friends named Naojiro HARADA.
sen.cmt: 文末にピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: He also had a close relationship with Ogai MORI, and treated one of Ogai's best friends named Naojiro HARADA.

sen.j: 脚気は感染症であるという説を生涯主張し当時の日本医学会では定説となっていたが、現在では否定されている。
sen.e: He insisted all his life that beriberi was an infectious disease, which became an established theory in Japanese Association of Medical Sciences at that time, but it has been refuted at present.
He insisted all his life that beriberi was an infectious disease, which became an established theory in Japanese Association of Medical Sciences at that time, but it is refused at present.
sen.cmt: 文末をit is refusedに訂正しました。
sen.e: He insisted all his life that beriberi was an infectious disease, which became an established theory in Japanese Association of Medical Sciences at that time, but it is refused at present.

sen.j: 一方で、東京大学医科学研究所の前身である伝染病研究所の東京大学医学部統合を推進し伝染病研究所の創設者である北里柴三郎と激しく対立した。
sen.e: On the other hand, he attempted to integrate the Institute of Infectious Disease, the precursor of the Institute of Medical Science, the University of Tokyo into the university's Faculty of Medicine, over which he was involved in a fierce battle with Shibasaburo KITASHIBA, the founder of the institute.

On the other hand, he attempted to integrate the Institute of Infectious Disease, the precursor of the Institute of Medical Science, the University of Tokyo into the university's Faculty of Medicine, over which he was involved in a fierce battle with Shibasaburo KITASATO, the founder of the institute.
sen.cmt: 北里の訳に誤記をKITASATOに訂正しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, he attempted to integrate the Institute of Infectious Disease, the precursor of the Institute of Medical Science, the University of Tokyo into the university's Faculty of Medicine, over which he was involved in a fierce battle with Shibasaburo KITASATO, the founder of the institute.

sen.j: 1895「千八百九十四年香港ニ流行セルペスト病ニ就イテ」中外医事新報 377,1428-1433,
sen.e: On Plague Epidemic in Hong Kong of 1894,' 1895, Chugai Iji Shinpo, 377,1428-1433

sen.e: Brief Summary of Research on Plague in Hong Kong,' 1894, the national hygiene association Dainihon Shiri-tsu Eiseikai, 138,941-959
